recipe.name: Spaghetti With Clam Sauce
recipe.description: A quick and flavorful pasta dish featuring tender spaghetti tossed in a savory sauce made from canned clams, garlic, white wine, and a touch of soy sauce for added umami.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

steps: In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter until foaming subsides. Add diced celery, shallots, and half of the parsley. Cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are softened and fragrant, about 1 to 2 minutes.
Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes to the skillet. Cook, stirring constantly, until garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.

Pour in white wine, reserved clam juice from the cans, and bottled clam juice. Increase heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until liquid is slightly reduced, about 5 minutes.
Stir in drained clam meat and soy sauce. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Keep the sauce warm over low heat.
In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water, then drain the spaghetti.
Add cooked spaghetti to the skillet with the clam sauce. Toss to combine, adding reserved pasta water as needed to achieve desired sauce consistency.
Remove skillet from heat and stir in remaining parsley and lemon zest. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper if necessary.
Serve immediately, garnished with additional parsley and lemon zest if desired.
